name: GCDualSenseAdaptiveTrigger
desc: A class that encapsulates the features of a DualSense adaptive trigger.

items.name: var mode: GCDualSenseAdaptiveTrigger.Mode
items.desc: The current configuration of the adaptive trigger.

items.name: func setModeFeedbackWithStartPosition(Float, resistiveStrength: Float)
items.desc: Sets the mode to provide feedback when the user depresses the trigger at the start position or at a greater value.

items.name: func setModeWeaponWithStartPosition(Float, endPosition: Float, resistiveStrength: Float)
items.desc: Sets the mode to provide feedback when the user depresses the trigger between the start and end positions.

items.name: func setModeVibrationWithStartPosition(Float, amplitude: Float, frequency: Float)
items.desc: Sets the mode to vibrate when the user depresses the trigger at the start position or at a greater value.

items.name: func setModeOff()
items.desc: Sets the mode to off and stops any trigger effect.

items.name: enum GCDualSenseAdaptiveTrigger.Mode
items.desc: The possible modes of an adaptive trigger.

items.name: var armPosition: Float
items.desc: The position of the trigger’s arm.

items.name: var status: GCDualSenseAdaptiveTrigger.Status
items.desc: The current status of the adaptive trigger and whether it’s applying effects.

items.name: enum GCDualSenseAdaptiveTrigger.Status
items.desc: The possible states of an adaptive trigger.

items.name: func setModeSlopeFeedback(startPosition: Float, endPosition: Float, startStrength: Float, endStrength: Float)
